main event: On October 2, 1957 in Seminole, Texas, a reddish white object approximately three feet wide and four feet long was observed moving in a straight line formation, covering approximately 12 miles in 30 minutes at an altitude of 100 feet.
interesting points: The object was described as egg-shaped, resembling a large round table.
It moved in a straight line formation with no tail, trail, or exhaust, and produced no sound.
The observations were made using ground visual and naked eye, during a night with heavy overcast and no reported thunderstorms in the area.
A weather station at Hobbs, Texas provided information on the wind and cloud cover in the area.
Flights of F-100 aircraft enroute from England AFB, Alexandria, LA to Cannon AFB, N.M. and Kirtland AFB, N.M. were in the area during the reported sightings.
sighted object: reddish white object approximately three feet wide and four feet long
